N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 453.6 - Security

State Regulations
(a) The program
must provide 24-hour security at the facility to meet the physical safety needs
of residents and staff. At a minimum, each facility must have safety locks on
all exit and entry doors. These doors must be secured at all times, and
specific admittance procedures must be in place for anyone entering the
facility. (b) A description of the
security system must be submitted to the Office for review and approval prior
to the issuance of any operating certificate or extension thereof. (c) Based upon the individual characteristics
of each program, including, but not limited to location of the facility and the
extent to which the location is known in the community, size of the facility, construction characteristics of the facility, and use of the building or site
location for purposes other than the provision of services to victims of
domestic violence, additional security measures, including, but not limited to, the hiring of staff and installation of security devices may be required. Notes
